spanish: Mi hijo cumplirá seis años el próximo mes.
Mi hijo cumplirá seis años el mes que viene.
english: My son will be six years old next month.

spanish: La Sra. White nos da una prueba todos los días.
english: Ms. White gives us a test every day.

spanish: ¿Cómo se dice libro en chino?
english: How do you say book in Chinese?

spanish: Cada una de las lecciones es importante.
english: Each of the lessons is important.

spanish: Querían estar solos durante una hora.
english: They wanted to be by themselves for an hour.

spanish: Apoyo la libertad de expresión.
english: I support freedom of expression.

spanish: Se me cayó el teléfono mientras jugaba al tenis.
english: I dropped my phone while I was playing tennis.

spanish: La tormenta ha retrasado su vuelo.
english: The storm has delayed their flight.
The storm has delayed your flight.

spanish: Estuvimos acampando unos días, pero ya estamos en casa.
english: We were camping for a few days, but we are home now.

spanish: Hemos estado acampando durante unos días, pero ya estamos en casa.
english: We've been camping for a few days, but we're home now.

spanish: ¿Cómo van las clases?
english: How are the classes going?

spanish: ¿Como estas?
english: How are you doing?
How are you?
How do you do?

spanish: ¿Cómo va todo?
¿Cómo va?
¿Cómo te va?
english: How is it going?
How's it going?

spanish: No hablo mucho, mis compañeros hablan más que yo.
No digo mucho, mis compañeros de trabajo hablan más que yo.
english: I don't say much, my coworkers talk more than I do.
I don't say much, my coworkers talk more than me.

spanish: Fue a su escritorio a buscar una engrapadora.
Fue a su escritorio a buscar una grapadora.
english: She went to her desk to get a stapler.
He went to his desk to get a stapler.

spanish: Hizo algunas preguntas difíciles, pero yo estaba preparado.
english: He asked some hard questions, but I was prepared.
He asked some tough questions, but I was prepared.

spanish: ¿La Sra. White nos dio tarea?
english: Did Ms. White give us homework?
Did Mrs. White give us homework?

spanish: Conduzco al trabajo todos los días.
english: I drive to work every day.

spanish: Juan ya me ha mostrado los alrededores.
english: John has already shown me around.

spanish: José tiene muchas ganas de ir a nadar a la playa.
english: Jose really wants to go for a swim at the beach.
Jose really wants to go swimming at the beach.

spanish: ¿Qué hay de comprar unas pizzas?
english: What about getting some pizzas?
What about buying some pizzas?

spanish: ¿Qué hay de comprar unas pizzas?
english: What about getting some pizzas?
What about buying some pizzas?
